basics.name: Gregory Danielson III
basics.label: Software Engineering Team Lead
basics.summary: Software engineer looking to combine my interests in community organization/safety, natural language processing/acquisition, and education. Four years of experience in data-driven discovery and capture of illicit activity on many platforms including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram. Test, review, adjust is my core philosophy; you can't know without testing.

work.name: UAB Computer Forensics Research Laboratory
work.summary: Database and systems administration, devops, backend development, archicture, technical leadership.
highlights: Led projects that ended in the signing of high-value contracts, including the acquisition of a $750,000 contract for our work on Twitter
Developed and maintained tools for capturing content from social media including Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and other OSINT data sources
Developed a design methodology for storing social media en masse, OSINT data from a variety of sources and in a variety of formats into different PostgreSQL databases
Contributed to the design and implementation of a new access control system for use within the Computer Forensics Research Lab
Contributed to the design of many supportive webapps for accessing and analyzing aforementioned captured data
Re-designed devops methodology, webapp deploy process used by CFRL to enable developers to better test their applications locally and in CI
Researched and deployed an Elasticsearch cluster, allowing elasticsearch-supported full text search in the form of a PostgreSQL index
Maintained and administered a pair of high performance CentOS servers for serving end users, mass compute, mass storage of data, running workers for aforementioned data capturing tools

work.name: University of Alabama at Birmingham
highlights: Developed and re-designed assignment structure
Created most documents used in lab materials
Developed consistent grading methodology
Ensured the success of hundreds of students in deeply understanding intel x86_64 ASM

awards.title: President's List
awards.summary: Qualified for President's List (achieved 4.0 GPA in 12+ credit hours of classes) in 3 out of 8 semesters.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Qualified for Dean's's List (achieved  >=3.6 GPA in 12+ credit hours of classes) in 4 out of 8 semesters.

awards.title: Presidential Recognition Scholarship
awards.summary: Highly competitive academic scholarship providing full tuition payment for UAB students qualifying via their academic accomplishments before college

certificates.title: Cyber Security Certificate
certificates.summary: Successfully completed a series of courses on technological security throughout the completion of a Master of Science in Computer Science.

references.name: Gary Warner

projects.name: Linku: a Toki Pona dictionary in a bot, database, and website
projects.description: Toki Pona previously had dozens of differently thorough and opinionated dictionaries. Now it has one, and a collection of tools to make that data useful.
highlights: Automatic updating of font data
Designed a reproducible prod environment for bot
Improved interactivity and informativity of dictionary

projects.name: Static Site Generator I Guess
projects.description: A static site generator I built for my websites.
highlights: Content distribution purely via repo

projects.name: Mozilla Common Voice
projects.description: Collecting parallel voice and text to build an open corpus for training
highlights: Translated entire user interface into Toki Pona
Contributed entry verification bugfixes to input on Pontoon

projects.name: wttr.in
projects.description: A weather service for your terminal. curl wttr.in
highlights: Corrected a longstanding bug where the province (or state, for the US) would be omitted when searching for the current weather. For example, searching for the weather from Helena, Alabama would return the weather for Helena, Montana.
Adjusted the cache system in a backwards compatible manner to keep useful information from geolocation lookups.

projects.name: Cool Space Things
projects.description: A visualization of man-made satellite data from n2yo at coolspacethings.neocities.org

projects.name: Lilyvim
projects.description: A plugin to preview Lilypond scores while editing them in Vim.

projects.name: Sysadmin Telebot
projects.description: A configurable Telegram bot for managing a remote system without opening a port

projects.name: chip8
projects.description: A chip8 emulator written in C
highlights: Practiced emulator development, UI design, an odd ASM
